FAQ

Home Blog Tools Telegram Instagram Threads

Do you sell guaranteed tips?

No. Educational content only – no guarantees.

What is CLV?

Closing Line Value – whether your price beats the closing market long-term.

How much should I stake?

Units (0.5–2%) or part-Kelly (0.25–0.50). Always respect limits.

Legal & compliance?

Follow local laws and platform terms at all times.

item.yandex:full-text: Unit 0.5–2%; part-Kelly 0.25–0.50; −10% monthly stop; evaluate via CLV.
item.turbo:content:
Bankroll Management 101

Home Tools Telegram

Unit = 0.5–2% of bankroll. Don’t size up after a short heater.

f* = max(0,(b·p − (1−p))/b) × 0.25…0.50

  • Monthly drawdown stop: −10% ⇒ pause & review.
  • Increase units only when CLV is stably positive (≥300 bets).
Educational only.

item.yandex:full-text: Avoid loss-chasing and stake bloat; account for fees/FX; be modest with long parlays.
item.turbo:content:
Common Bankroll Mistakes

  • Chasing losses
  • Upsizing after short streaks
  • Ignoring fees/FX/settlement delays
  • Overexposure to long parlays

Fix unit, set day/month loss limits, weekly review, track CLV.

item.turbo:topic: Bankroll tracking: units, bet log, CLV
item.yandex:full-text: Log market, price, closing, result, fees; compare your price vs. CLV.
item.turbo:content:
Why & how to track your bankroll

Record every bet: date, market, price, closing, result, fees. Use a simple sheet or our tools.

item.yandex:full-text: If your average price beats the close, you’re capturing value; avoid small-sample bias.
item.turbo:content:
Closing Line Value

CLV indicates whether you consistently secure better prices than the market close.

item.yandex:full-text: Hedging cuts variance but eats value; use for info shifts or risk caps.
item.turbo:content:
Hedging Basics

Use hedges sparingly – clear reasons only (new info, exposure beyond plan).

item.turbo:topic: Home/Away bias: when does the market overrate it?
item.yandex:full-text: Home edge varies with travel, congestion, crowd, bench quality – not constant.
item.turbo:content:
Home/Away Bias

Assess context: travel, schedule density, atmosphere, rotations.

item.yandex:full-text: Quick convert: probability = 1/decimal; try the calculator.
item.turbo:content:
How To Read Odds

Probability = 1 / decimal odds – calculator in Tools.

item.yandex:full-text: Evaluate role/usage, substitute quality, and timing impact; early news → CLV chance.
item.turbo:content:
Evaluating Injury Impact

  • Role/usage: creation, pressing, set pieces
  • Substitute: bench level & impact
  • Timing: early news = opportunity; late = slippage risk

item.yandex:full-text: f* = max(0,(b·p−(1−p))/b); use 0.25–0.50 Kelly to reduce risk.
item.turbo:content:
Kelly Criterion Explained

b = decimal − 1, f* = max(0,(b·p−(1−p))/b). In practice, apply partial Kelly.

item.turbo:topic: Line shopping: small edges → big CLV
item.yandex:full-text: Use multiple licensed books, account for margin/fees/FX; 1–3 ticks compound CLV.
item.turbo:content:
Line Shopping Guide

Compare before you bet. Small price edges compound if you stay disciplined.

item.yandex:full-text: Latency kills edge; set pieces priced differently; respect unit & exposure cap.
item.turbo:content:
Live Betting Principles

Never chase in-play. Mind latency and keep exposure within plan.

item.yandex:full-text: Moves come from news, limits, hedging, pro flows; not every move is value.
item.turbo:content:
Market Movements 101

Understand the cause before acting. Distinguish noise vs. information.

item.yandex:full-text: Good probabilities “come true” long-term; inspect reliability plots and error metrics.
item.turbo:content:
Model Calibration

Use reliability curves, Brier score, and LogLoss to catch over/under-confidence.

item.yandex:full-text: Compare to liquid references; subtract margin/fees/FX; always shop around.
item.turbo:content:
Odds Comparison

Small differences add up to CLV over time when you’re disciplined.

item.yandex:full-text: Set limits, never chase, pause if it’s not fun; find local help resources.
item.turbo:content:
Responsible Betting

Use self-limit tools and never risk money you can’t afford to lose.

item.yandex:full-text: Bet only when your fair probability exceeds implied after margin/fees.
item.turbo:content:
Value Betting Basics

Value = good estimate + good price + bankroll discipline.

item.yandex:full-text: Streaks ≠ decision quality; track emotions, avoid revenge bets; stick to plan.
item.turbo:content:
Variance & Tilt

Don’t overreact to 1–2 matches. Journal, set stops, plan breaks.

item.yandex:full-text: xG captures chance quality; results swing. Use both for pricing decisions.
item.turbo:content:
xG & Form

Look for sustainable performance across multiple matches, not single-game noise.

item.yandex:full-text: Goals are noisy; xG tracks quality. Respect sample size.
item.turbo:content:
xG vs Goals

Don’t anchor on outliers. Sample size matters.
